ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GEN_PHY_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Can be 0x5A5A_5A5A to indicate that this field is invalid; otherwise, it is set to the MII PHY ID value.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GEN_BC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to 0xFEFE_0009 at S2 start. Possibly boot progress indicator. Upper 16 is always 0xFEFE, possible validity indicator. Observed lower16 values: 8 9 - Stage2 start

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GEN_FW_VERSION
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set from NVM 0x096; firmware version and upper 16 bits of manufacturing date.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GEN_CPMU_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The upper 16 bits of this is the upper 16 bits of

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: More of these bits can be found in diagnostic utilities, but they don't seem too interesting.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Used to reset the APE block.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE is halted if set. Setting then unsetting this bit resets the APE to its reset vector, etc.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Fast Boot
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Can be used to boot from RAM instead of NVM. Takes a full APE image with section headers, etc. so you still need to form a proper image.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Event 1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Used to signal the APE that an event from the host is ready for processing in SHM.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LAN 0 Dstate
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates port is in D3 if set, otherwise the port is in D0-D2.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LAN 1 Dstate
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates port is in D3 if set, otherwise the port is in D0-D2.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GPIO_MESSAGE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Related to APE fastboot. In that case the value of it is an APE memory address in the code region. If Fast Boot is set, and the low two bits of this are not 0b10, ROM hangs (you have to OR 0x2 into the address). Otherwise, they are masked off and the resulting value is used as the reset vector. The resulting value is also stored in this register (i.e., the low two bits are cleared).

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Event 1

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RXBufOffset Func0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This is examined on the APE Packet RX interrupt, and indicates the offset of an incoming (from-network) frame within the APE memory space, which provides access to the from-network RX buffer.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RXBufOffset Func1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This is examined on the APE Packet RX interrupt, and indicates the offset of an incoming (from-network) frame within the APE memory space, which provides access to the from-network RX buffer.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: GINT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: TODO: See diag for field info.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: unknown_31_28
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If this is all-ones, it appears to mean the APE FW is halted.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: SEG_MESSAGE_BUFFER_OFFSET
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Specifies the offset of a scratchpad area, relative to the start of the APE SHM area (i.e., relative to APE_REG(0x4000)).

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: SEG_MESSAGE_BUFFER_LENGTH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Specifies the size of the scratchpad area in bytes.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RCPU_SEG_SIG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to APE_RCPU_MAGIC ('RCPU') by RX CPU.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RCPU_INIT_COUNT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Incremented by RX CPU every boot.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RCPU_FW_VERSION
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to the bootcode version. e.g. 0x0127 -> v1.39.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RCPU_PCI_VENDOR_DEVICE_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to PCI Vendor/Device ID by S2.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RCPU_PCI_SUBSYSTEM_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to PCI Subsystem Vendor/Subsystem ID by S2.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: HOST_SEG_SIG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to APE_HOST_MAGIC ('HOST') to indicate the section is valid.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: HOST_INIT_COUNT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Incremented by host on every initialization.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: HOST_DRIVER_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Linux sets this to 0xF0MM_mm00, where M is the major version of Linux and m is the minor version.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: In milliseconds. Set to 0 to disable heartbeating.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PROT_MAGIC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This is set to APE_PROT_MAGIC ('PROT') on all functions. If it is 'PROT', the following fields (MAC0_HIGH/LOW) are valid

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PROT_MAC0_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: High 16 bits of MAC address 0. Only valid if

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: NCSI_SIG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Set to NCSI_MAGIC ('NCSI') by APE firmware. NOTE: all words in the NCSI section are available in the function 0 SHM area only.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: NCSI_BUILD_TIME
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ASCII string spanning three 32-bit words. Unused trailing bytes are set to zero.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: NCSI_BUILD_DATE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: ASCII string spanning three 32-bit words. Unused trailing bytes are set to zero.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: CHIP_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The APE code copies the contents of Chip ID to this word

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PER_LOCK_REQUEST_PHY0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register, and the following Per Lock Request registers work the same. The tg3 driver uses 0x0000_1000 (APELOCK_PER_REQ_DRIVER) for PHY ports (or always for function 0).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Done
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Sequence completion bit that is asserted when the command requested by assertion of the doit bit has completed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Doit
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Command from software to start the defined command. The done bit must be clear before setting this bit. This bit is self clearing and will remain set while the command is active.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Wr
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The write/not read command bit. Set to execute write or erase.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Erase
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The erase command bit. Set high to execute an erase. This bit is ignored if the wr is clear.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: First
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is passed to the SEE_FSM or SPI_FSM if the pass_mode bit is set

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Last
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, the next command sequence is interpreted as the last one of a burst and any cleanup work is done.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The write enable command bit. Set '1' will make the flash interface state machine generate a write enable command cycle to the flash device to set the write enable bit in the device status register. This command is used for devices with a write protection function.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Disable Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The write disable command bit. Set '1' will make the flash interface state machine generate a write disable command cycle to the flash device to clear the write enable bit in the device status register. This command is used for devices with a write protection function.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: WRITE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: 32bits of write data are used when write commands are executed.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ADDR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The 24 bit address for a read or write operation (must be 4 byte aligned).

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: READ
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: 32bits of read data are used when read commands are executed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Flash Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable Flash Interface mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Buffer Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable SSRAM Buffered Interface mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPI CLK DIV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The equation to calculate the clock freq. for SCK is: CORE_CLK / ((SPI_CLK_DIV + 1) * 2)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Page Size
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: These bits indicate the page size of the attached flash device. They are set automatically depending on the chosen flash as indicated by the strapping option pins.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Erase Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This is the Flash page erase command.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Status Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This is the Flash status register read command.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Command to write a series of bytes into a selected page in the Flash device. Note: this write command wraps around to the beginning of the page after the internal address counter in the Flash device reaches the end of the page.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Read Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This is the Flash/SEEPROM read command. Following this command, any number of bytes may be read up to the end of the flash memory.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When 1, allows the NVRAM write command to be issued even if the NVRAM write enable bit 21 of the mode control register 0x6800.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When 0, prevents write access to all other NVRAM registers, except for the Software arbitration register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Flash write enable command when device with protection function is used. This command will be issued by the flash interface state machine through SPI interface.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Disable Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Flash write disable command when device with protection function is used. This command will be issued by the flash interface state machine through SPI interface.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: reserved
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Auto Config Busy
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto Configuration Busy

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Auto Config Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto config feature is enabled through pin strap.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Auto Config Successful
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto config is successful.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Auto Config State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto Config FSM state.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Auto Detected Device ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto detected device ID.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Clear Interrupt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Setting this bit will clear interrupt as long as the mask interrupt bit is not set.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Mask Interrupt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Setting this bit will mask future interrupt events from being generated.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Endian Byte Swap
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable endian byte swapping when accessing through PCIE target interface.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Endian Word Swap
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable endian word swapping when accessing through PCIE target interface.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable PCI State Register Read/Write Capability
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable PCI state register read/ write capability, otherwise the register is read only.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Clock Control Register Read/Write Capability
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit enable clock control register read/ write capability, otherwise, the clock control register is read only.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Register Word Swap
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable word swapping when accessing registers through the PCI target device.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Indirect Access
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable indirect addressing mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Mask Interrupt Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the interrupt is masked.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Tagged Status Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, an unique 8-bit tag value will be inserted into the Status block status tag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RCB Check
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable RCB check.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Interrupt Check
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable the interrupt check.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Byte Enable Rule Check
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable the byte enable rule check.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Boundary Check
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable crossing 4 KB boundary check.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Log Header Overflow
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable log header due to overflow.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TLP Minor Error Tolerance
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to enable TLP minor error tolerance (ATTR/TC/LOCK command).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Metal Rev ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Metal Rev Number

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: All Layer ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: External All Layer Revision ID.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Product ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Product ID.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PCI Expansion ROM Desired
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable PCI ROM base address register to be visible to the PCI host

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PCI Expansion ROM Retry
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Force PCI Retry for accesses to Expansion ROM region if enabled

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VPD Available
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit reads as 1 if the VPD region of the NVRAM can be accessed by the host

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Flat View
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Asserted if the Base Address register presents a 32 MB PCI Address map flat view, otherwise, indicates a 64 KB PCI Address map in standard view

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Max PCI Target Retry
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates the number of PCI clock cycles before Retry occurs, in multiple of 8.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Config Retry
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When asserted, forces all config access to be retried.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE Control Register Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set the APE control registers may be written.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE Shared Memory Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set the APE shared memory region may be written.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE Program Space Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set the APE program space may be written.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: REGISTER_BASE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Local controller memory address of a register than can be written or read by writing to the register data register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MEMORY_BASE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Local controller memory address of the NIC memory region that can be accessed via Memory Window data register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: REGISTER_DATA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register Data at the location pointed by the Register Base Register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MEMORY_DATA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Memory value at the location pointed by the Memory Base Register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: UNDI_RECEIVE_RETURN_RING_CONSUMER_INDEX
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: UNDI Receive Return Ring Consumer Index Mailbox

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: UNDI_RECEIVE_RETURN_RING_CONSUMER_INDEX_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: UNDI Receive Return Ring Consumer Index Mailbox

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Global Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set to 1, the MAC state machine is reset. This is a self-clearing bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Half Duplex
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the MII/GMII interface is configured to operate in half-duplex mode and the CSMA/ CD state machines in the MAC are set to half-duplex mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Loopback Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, an internal loopback path is enabled from the transmit MAC to the receive MAC. This bit is provided for diagnostic purposes only.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Tagged MAC Control
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Allow the MAC to receive tagged MAC control packets.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TX Bursting
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable transmit bursting in gigabit half-duplex mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Max Defer
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable Max Deferral checking statistic.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable RX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable receive statistics external updates.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Clear RX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Clear receive statistics internal RAM. This bit is self-clearing.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Flush RX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write receive statistics to external memory. This bit is self-clearing.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable transmit statistics external updates.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Clear TX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Clear transmit statistics internal RAM. This bit is self-clearing.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Flush TX Statistics
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write transmit statistics to external memory. This bit is self-clearing.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Send Config Command
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Send config commands when in TBI mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Magic Packet Detection Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable Magic Packet detection.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ACPI Power On Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable Wake on LAN filters when in powerdown mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TCE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable Transmit DMA engine.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable RDE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable RDMA engine. Must be set for normal operation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable FHDE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable receive Frame Header DMA engine. Must be set for normal operation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Halt Interesting Packet PME
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, the WOL signal will not be asserted on an interesting packet match.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Free-Running ACPI
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, the ACPI state machine will continue running when a match is found. When this bit is clear, the ACPI state machine will halt when a match is found.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable APE RX Path
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit must be written a 1 for APE subsystem to receive packets from the EMAC.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable APE TX Path
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit must be written a 1 for the EMAC to transmit APE packets.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Override Link
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set, overrides hardware control of the three link LEDs. The LEDs will be controlled via bits [3:1].

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LED 1000
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set along with the LED Override bit, turns on the 1000 Mbps LED.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LED 100
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set along with the LED Override bit, turns on the 100 Mbps LED.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LED 10
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set along with the LED Override bit, turns on the 10 Mbps LED.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Override Traffic
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set, overrides hardware control of the Traffic LED. The Traffic LED will then be controlled via bits [6:5].

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LED Traffic Blink
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set along with the Override Traffic bit and Traffic LED bit, the Traffic LED will blink with the blink rate specified in Override Blink Rate (bit 31) and Blink Period (bits [30:19]) fields.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LED Traffic
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set along with the Override Traffic bit, the Traffic LED is turned on.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MAC Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, the traffic LED blinks only when traffic is addressed for the device (The LED_MODE field must be set to 00 before enabling this bit).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shared Traffic/Link LED Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, the Link LED is solid green when there is a link and blinks when there is traffic. (The LED_MODE field must be set to 00 before enabling this bit).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Blink Period
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the period of each blink cycle (on+off) for Traffic LED in milliseconds. Must be a nonzero value. This 12-bit field is reset to 0x040, giving a default blink period of approximately 15.9Hz.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Override Blink Rate
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If set, the blink rate for the Traffic LED is determined by the Blink Period field (bit 30 to bit 19). This bit is rest to 1.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_0_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Upper 2-bytes of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_0_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Lower 4-byte of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_1_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Upper 2-bytes of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_1_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Lower 4-byte of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_2_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Upper 2-bytes of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_2_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Lower 4-byte of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_3_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Upper 2-bytes of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EMAC_MAC_ADDRESSES_3_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Lower 4-byte of this node's MAC address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: WOL_PATTERN_POINTER
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Specifies the offset into the 6KB BD memory for frame comparison. (Bits 3:0 are ignored to align the memory address to a natural 128-bit boundary).

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MTU_SIZE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: 2-byte field which is the largest size frame that will be accepted without being marked as oversize.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MTU
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: 2-byte field which is the largest size frame that will be accepted without being marked as oversize.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Transaction Data
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When configured for a write command, the data stored at this location is written to the PHY at the specified PHY and register address. During a read command, the data returned by the PHY is stored at this location.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Register Address
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Address of the register to be read or written.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Read Failed
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the transceiver device did not drive the bus during the attempted read transaction. Valid after the Start/Busy bit is cleared.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Start/Busy
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set this bit to start a transaction. While it is high, it indicates that the current transaction is still ongoing. If enabled, generates an attention via EMAC Status Register MI Completion bit (bit 22).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PHY Address
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field specifies the PHY Address.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Constant MDIO/MDC Clock Speed
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable ~500Khz constant MII management interface (MDIO/MDC) frequency regardless core clock frequency.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MII Clock Count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counter to divide CORE_CLK (62.5 MHz) to generate the MI clock. CORE_CLK/2/(MII Clock Count + 1).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set to 1, the Transmit MAC state machine will be reset. This is a self-clearing bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TCE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Used to be enable TDE in legacy-same purpose.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Flow Control
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: MAC will send 802.3x flow control frames.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Big Backoff
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: MAC will use larger than normal back-off algorithm.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Long Pause
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the Pause time value set in the transmitted PAUSE frames is 0xFFFF.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Link Aware Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, transmission of packets by the MAC is enabled only when link is up.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TxMBUF Corruption Lockup Fix Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, TXMBUF corruption lockup fix is enabled.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TX ESP Offload
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A value 1 enables the TX ESP offload feature. When 0, offloaded ESP packet gets dropped. This value must be static.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable TX AH Offload
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A value 1 enables the TX AH offload feature. When 0, offloaded AH packet gets dropped. This value must be static.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set to 1, the Receive MAC state machine will be reset. This is a self-clearing bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit controls whether the Receive MAC state machine is active or not.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Promiscuous Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, no source address or MC hashing checking will be performed on incoming frames.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE Promiscuous Mode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, no source address or MC hashing checking will be performed on incoming frames on APE filter path.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: SGMII_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register reflects various status of the respective SGMII port when enabled.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Autonegotiation Complete
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Auto-negotiation process has completed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Speed 1000
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SGMII Link currently operable at 1 Gbps data speed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Speed 100
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SGMII Link currently operable at 100mbps data speed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Software Controlled GPHY Force DLL On
MAC Clock Switch
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Software Controlled MAC Core Clock Speed Select.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MAC Clock Switch
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Software Controlled MAC Core Clock Speed Select

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MAC Clock Speed Override Enabled
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable MAC clock speed override

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WOL Magic Packet Detection Enable Port 0
Ethernet Link Status
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: EthernetLink Status

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WOL Magic Packet Detection Enable Port 1
APE Status
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE Engine Status

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Function Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Function Enable input from System BIOS

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Function Number
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: PCIE function number

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: GPHY IDDQ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, GPHY will be powered down.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIAS IDDQ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, BIAS will be powered down.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CPMU Software Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Software reset for all the CPMU logic expect for registers.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CPMU Register Software Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Software reset for resetting all the registers to default.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SGMII/PCS Power Down
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Setting this bit will powerdown SGMII-PCS module.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MUTEX_REQUEST
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Writing a 1 to any of these bits pends a Mutex lock request on behalf of a software agent. The bit is subsequently latched by hardware and shall read 1 as long as the request is pending. Writing a 0 to a bit shall have no effect.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MUTEX_GRANT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Reading this field shall return a maximum of one set bit at any time. The set bit shall point to the lock owner. If the Mutex is not locked, then a read shall return a value 0x0000. Writing a 1 to the already set bit shall relinquish the lock and the set bit shall be cleared. Writing a 1 to an unset bit shall cancel the corresponding pending request if there was one, and the pairing bit in the Mutex_Request_Reg shall be cleared.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXMBUF ECC Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable TXMBUF ECC.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RXMBUF ECC Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable RXMBUF ECC.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RXCPU SPAD ECC Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable ECC for rxcpu scratchpad.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit controls whether the Buffer Manager is active or not.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Attention Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set to 1, an internal attention is generated when an error occurs.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reset RXMBUF Pointer
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is set, it will cause the RXMBUF allocation and deallocation pointer to reset back to the RXMBUF base.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PCI Request Burst Length for BD RDMA Engine
PCI Request Burst Length for NonLSO RDMA Engine
Reset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Self-clearing bit which resets only the RX RISC.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Single Step
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Advances the RX RISC's PC for one cycle. If halting condition still exists, the RX RISC will again halt; otherwise, it will resume normal operation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Page 0 Data Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, data references to the first 256 bytes of SRAM force the RX RISC to halt and cause bit 3 in the RX RISC state register to be latched. Cleared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Page 0 Instr Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, instruction references to the first 256 bytes of SRAM force the RX RISC to halt and cause bit 4 in the RX RISC state register to be latched. Cleared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Data Cache
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables the data cache. Cleared on reset. Note: Firmware developers should take care to clear this bit before polling internal SRAM memory locations, because the RX RISC processor uses a two-element LRU caching algorithm, which is not affected by writes from the PCI interface.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ROM Fail
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Asserted on reset. Cleared by ROM code after it successfully loads code from NVRAM. Afterwards, this bit can be used by software for any purpose.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Watchdog
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables watchdog interrupt state machine. Used in conjunction with Watchdog Clear register, Watchdog Saved PC register and Watchdog Vector register. Cleared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Instruction Cache
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables prefetch logic within the instruction cache. When disabled only a single cache line is read on a cache miss. Cleared on reset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Flush Instruction Cache
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Self-clearing bit which forces the instruction cache to flush.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Set by TX RISC or the host to halt the RX RISC. Cleared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Invalid Data Access Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the condition that causes RX RISC state bit 5 to be set, also halts the RX RISC. Set by reset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Invalid Instruction Access Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, the condition that causes RX RISC state bit 6 to be set, also halts the RX RISC. Set by reset.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Memory Address Trap Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, if the MA raises the trap signal to this processor, it will halt. CLeared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable Register Address Trap Halt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, if the GRC raises the trap signal to this processor, it will halt. CLeared on reset and Watchdog interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Hardware Breakpoint
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When enabled in mode register, indicates hardware breakpoint has been reached.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Halt Instruction Executed
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When enabled in mode register, indicates hardware breakpoint has been reached.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Invalid Instruction
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Invalid instruction fetched.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Page 0 Data Refeence
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When enabled in mode register, indicates data reference within lower 256 bytes of SRAM.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Page 0 Instruction Reference
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When enabled in mode register, indicates the address in the PC is within the lower 256 bytes of SRAM.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Invalid Data Access
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Data reference to illegal location.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Invalid Instruction Fetch
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Program Counter (PC) is set to invalid location in processor address space.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Bad Memory Alignment
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Load or Store instruction was executed with the least significant two address bits not valid for the width of the operation (e.g., Load word or Load Half-word from an odd byte address).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Memory Address Trap
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A signal was received from the Memory Arbiter indicating that some BCM5700 block, possibly this processor, accessed a memory location that triggered a software trap. The MA registers are used to configure memory address trapping.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Register Address Trap
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A signal was received from the Global Resources block indicating that this processor accessed a register location that triggered a software trap. The GRC registers are used to configure register address trapping.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Halted
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The RX RISC was explicitly halted via bit 10 in the RX RISC Mode register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Data Access Stall
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The processor is currently stalled due to a data access.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Instruction Fetch Stall
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The processor is currently stalled due to an instruction fetch.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Blocking Read
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A blocking data cache miss occurred, causing the RX RISC to stall while data is fetched from external (to the RX RISC) memory. This is intended as a debugging tool. No state is saved other than the fact that the miss occurred.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_RISC_PROGRAM_COUNTER
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The program counter register can be used to read or write the current Program Counter of the each CPU. Reads can occur at any time, however writes can only be performed when the CPU is halted. Writes will also clear any pending instruction in the decode stage of the pipeline. Bits 31-2 are implemented. 1s written to bits 1-0 are ignored.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_RISC_CURRENT_INSTRUCTION
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register contains the current word located at the program counter address loaded in

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_RISC_HARDWARE_BREAKPOINT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register is used to set a hardware breakpoint based on the RISC's program counter (PC). If the PC equals the value in this register, and the hardware breakpoint is enabled, the RISC is halted and the appropriate stopping condition is indicated in the RISC State Register. To enable the hardware breakpoint, simply write the byte address of the instruction to break on and clear the Disable Hardware Breakpoint bit.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_POWER_CONSUMPTION_INFO
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register is used to set PCIe Power Consumption information as reported in configuration space. It is loaded from NVM configuration data.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_POWER_DISSIPATED_INFO
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register is used to set PCIe Power Dissipated information as reported in configuration space. It is loaded from NVM configuration data.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_VPD_REQUEST
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register appears to be used to implement the PCI VPD capability. It is set to the VPD offset which was requested by the host by writing to the VPD register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_VPD_RESPONSE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register appears to be used to implement the PCI VPD capability. Bootcode writes the 32 bits of data loaded from the word requested by

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_VENDOR_DEVICE_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This is the undocumented register used to set the PCI Vendor/Device ID, which is configurable from NVM.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_SUBSYSTEM_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This is the undocumented register used to set the PCI Subsystem/Subsystem Vendor ID, which is configurable from NVM.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_CLASS_CODE_REVISION
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This undocumented register is suspected to set the class code and device revision in PCI configuration space. Unconfirmed.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_SERIAL_NUMBER_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This sets the low 32 bits of the 64-bit device serial number, which isexposed as a PCIe capability in configuration space.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_SERIAL_NUMBER_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This sets the high 32 bits of the 64-bit device serial number, which isexposed as a PCIe capability in configuration space.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: PCI_POWER_BUDGET_0
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Used to report power budget capability data to the host. The values are loaded from NVM, and up to eight values may be specified.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Base Power
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies in watts the base power value in the given operating condition.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Data Scale
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the scale to apply to the Base Power value.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM Sub State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management sub state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Type
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Power Rail
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the thermal load or power rail of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Base Power
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies in watts the base power value in the given operating condition.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Data Scale
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the scale to apply to the Base Power value.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM Sub State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management sub state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Type
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the thermal load or power rail of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management sub state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management sub state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the thermal load or power rail of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Base Power
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies in watts the base power value in the given operating condition.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Data Scale
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the scale to apply to the Base Power value.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM Sub State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management sub state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PM State
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Type
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the power management state of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Power Rail
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Specifies the thermal load or power rail of the operating condition being described.

ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The LSB in this undocumented and unknown register is set if the device is a LOM (LAN-on-Motherboard) design (i.e., builtin to a system and not an expansion card).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Time Sync Mode Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write 1 to this bit to enable Time Sync Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NVRAM Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The host must set this bit before attempting to update the Flash or SEEPROM.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MDI_CONTROL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The register manual only mentions this in the changelog; it was removed from the manual in a previous revision. :|

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Program Counter
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field is used by the CPU to keep track of the location of the phase 1 boot code in RX MBUF.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is used by the CPU to keep track of whether or not there is valid phase 1 boot code stored in the RX MBUF. If the bit is set, then RXMBUF contains valid boot code. Otherwise, it is assumed that RXMBUF does not contain valid boot code.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EXPANSION_ROM_ADDR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Expansion ROM base address, expect to be d- word aligned.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Timesync GPIO Mapping
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MAC/Port dedicated TimeSync_GPIO pin is mapped via this field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE GPIO 0 Mapping
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE_GPIO[0] pin is mapped to 1588 input/ output via this field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE GPIO 1 Mapping
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE_GPIO[1] pin is mapped to 1588 input/ output via this field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE GPIO 2 Mapping
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE_GPIO[2] pin is mapped to 1588 input/ output via this field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: APE GPIO 3 Mapping
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: APE_GPIO[3] pin is mapped to 1588 input/ output via this field

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: OUI High
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bits 3:18 of organizationally unique identifier

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: OUI Low
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bits 19:24 of organizationally unique identifier.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: Autonegotiation Advertisement
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bits in this register indicate what capability bits are advertised to the link partner.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: Autonegotiation Link Partner Ability Base Page
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bits in this register indicate the capabilities of the link partner.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: Autonegotiation Link Partner Ability Next Page

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Unidirectional Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, able to transmit packets when no link

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Bypass Encoder
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: bypass 4B5B encoder and decoder

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Autonegotiation Base Page Selector Field Mismatch

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: Local Remote Receiver Not OK Counter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done on a single cycle (no setup required). Reads are selected by first writing to register 18h, shadow 7, bits 14:12.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables writes to bits [8:3]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done by first setting up the register. Reads can be done immediately after selecting the shadow register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write bits [9:0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done by first setting up the register. Reads can be done immediately after selecting the shadow register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write bits [9:0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done by first setting up the register. Reads can be done immediately after selecting the shadow register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write bits [9:0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done by first setting up the register. Reads can be done immediately after selecting the shadow register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Write Enable
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write bits [9:0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Shadow Register Selector
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writes to the selected shadow register are done by first setting up the register. Reads can be done immediately after selecting the shadow register.
